Posts.Content: On Feb 19, 2009 12:00 AM Chrissie_Lou wrote: Hi there, I'm so sorry to hear about your diagnosis.  I was diagnosed with metaplastic carcinoma in my right breast 11 months ago.  My lump was 5 centimeters.  Mine had not spread to the lymph nodes and my scans were clear.  I had chemo first (6 rounds of TAC).  The size of my lump reduced to 1.8 cm. so the chemo was quite effective.  I still chose to have a mastectomy (bilateral) and am glad I did.  I didn't mind having chemo first because it gave me time to really mentally prepare for the mastectomy vs. lumpectomy decision.  Due to the size of the lump I also had 33 radiation treatments to the chest wall.  I finished all treatments in November and just had a follow-up visit with my oncologist.  All is clear now and I am better than ever!   I know that it's scary knowing what you face ahead of you, but hang in there.  I am a success story and have confidence that you will be, too! Please let me know if I can answer any other questions for you or help in any way.  There are several of us on the message board that remain in contact with one another who have had metaplastic carcinoma and are doing well.   Best wishes, Chris Hi There, My sister has Triple Negative Metaplastic Carcinoma, she has had chemo, radiation, and masectomy. At her last Doctors appointment I was with her and she had some questions that the Doctor couldn't/wouldn't answer. She wanted to know the prognosis of Triple Negative Metaplastic Carcinoma. Are there any patients who have had this and it has not returned? He just said that it is so rare that little is known about it.  She really would like to have more information, and I just want to help her so much.
